image.altText: A middle-aged man with grey-white hair wearing a grey T-shirt looks serious in front of a plain background.

props.synopsis: The threat came shortly before US Attorney-General Pam Bondi said the Justice Department was ready to ask courts to unseal some grand jury transcripts related to the Epstein case, a move that falls short of what has been demanded by even his own supporters.

title.children: Trump threatens to sue Murdoch over Wall Street Journal report alleging letter to Epstein

image.altText: A close up of Mark Latham

props.synopsis: Veteran federal minster Tanya Plibersek says she is baffled as to why Mark Latham's portrait remains among other leaders of the federal Labor party.

title.children: Plibersek says she cried the day Latham became federal Labor leader

image.altText: USAID logo

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents obtained by the ABC show Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) officials sought to work out what projects would be affected by Donald Trump’s decision to close USAID.

title.children: USAID returns Australian aid money after DFAT request

image.altText: Sketch of a man with short hair, a white shirt and a black tie.

props.synopsis: The ex-partner of a Victorian woman tells a Supreme Court trial that he is guilty of her murder, prompting cheers from her friends and family as he is led from the court.

title.children: In shock move, Lachlan Young pleads guilty to murder of Hannah McGuire

image.altText: A smiling older man leans on the wing of a small plane outside a hangar in a country area.

title.children: Snowy Mountains plane crash not survivable, police say

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: Four people accused of murdering Australian brothers Jake and Callum Robinson appear in a Mexican court. A legal document reveals two of the men have alleged links to the country's notorious Sinaloa cartel.

title.children: Surfers' alleged killers face Mexican court as document reveals cartel claims

image.altText: Stephen Colbert on set on his show pointing at his salt and pepper moustache

props.synopsis: CBS has announced The Late Show with Stephen Colbert will end after the upcoming broadcast season, while a Democratic senator ponders whether political interference is at play.

title.children: Stephen Colbert's late night show has been cancelled and will not be replaced

image.altText: Two women with shoulder-length hair smile at the camera, with one wearing a black-and-white backpack

props.synopsis: The move would allow 16-year-olds to vote at the next UK national election and would be the biggest change to the country's electorate in more than half a century.

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

image.altText: A pile of bright coloured ants pile together to create a raft on water. the photo is so close you can see a reflection

props.synopsis: As fire ants continue their relentless march across south-east Queensland, a biological control expert from the United States warns "one or two selfish individuals" could destroy Australia's eradication plan.

image.altText: A billabong of water sits inbetween rows of River Red Gum trees.

image.altText: A girl smiling in a school photo

image.altText: View of mountains in a golden yellow colour, hazy sky in the horizon.

image.altText: Five men standing next two each other in a row and looking at the camera.

title.children: Youth camp founder Geoffrey Guest on trial for child sexual assault

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.
